subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Guillermo Barros Schelotto, a midfield wizard for the Columbus Crew who was a longtime star in his native Argentina, was named the most valuable player in Major League Soccer. Schelotto, 35, had 19 assists and 7 goals for Columbus as the Crew bounced back from a 9-11-10 record the previous year to finish with a league-best mark of 17-7-6. He and his teammates face the Red Bulls on Sunday afternoon in Carson, Calif., for the M.L.S. Cup.
